Html:
Hi,

Another cool feature would be to have a "value ball" that follows the graph in either the x or y plane:

http://docs.google.com/View?docid=dfbww44_23hqtnm9dc

This could then be displayed with a tooltop or retrieved to be shown in a textbox elsewhere.

Nick

Good idea, we've thought about it, too.

Definitely we'll have it in D3, but now I can't say something certain about dates.

Hi,

We've added some part of the feature we've spoken about.

I've recorded two videos about something that you are possibly speaking about: 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p0RTpIPPi0o and

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FynTxBbocXY

These projects are available in 'Source code' page, in the latest Changeset, in DynamicDataDisplay.sln/DevSamples/ projects LineTestSample and AxisControlSample.

If you have more questions, I'll willingly answer them.

 

Best regards,

Mikhail.

Hi all !

I'm sorry to open again this post....

But i'm very interesting about thecentury's project "LimeTestSample" and "AxisControlSample". It's exactly just I want ! But I don't find these project ...

Can you tell me where i can find it ?

Thanks a lot,

Elite

I found LineTestSample and AxisControlSample in this changeset: http://dynamicdatadisplay.codeplex.com/SourceControl/changeset/28519.

Many things changed in D3 code since then. Are there any examples how to achieve that functionality on current (latest) code?

Regards,
virious
